page.title: 09ENVIRONMENTAL EVALUATION
page.content: A clump of sycamore trees surmounts the sandstone quarry opposite the Green. There is much dramatic potential in this village green setting, with its diversity of buildings nearby and the narrow winding alignment of lanes entering the area in cuttings or between steep hedgerow banks .The variation of mood between enclosure and openess and the generally unspoilt settlement of Fulford are great assets to be conserved. Another bulding worthy of preservation is Olde House Farm.This is situated west of the crossroads and at present uncluttered by adjoining buildings. It is one of the most important buildings to conserve due to its archictectural qualities of fine timber work.It is a good example of pre-industrial construction using local timber.
